params.text:
• Identify different types of instructions
  • Review the reading strategy
  • Put it into practice

Reading

Understand Simple Instructions 2

Language in Action
Reading: Introduction

This module expands your skills to tackle different types of instructions you might encounter in daily life. 

Here's what you'll explore:

1. Instruction Variety: Learn about common instruction formats, like recipes, procedures, and how-to guides.

  2. Reading Strategies - Review & Refine: Sharpen your reading skills to find key information in instructions.

  3. Putting It Into Practice: Test your newfound knowledge by applying it to real-world instruction examples!
Identify Different Types of Instructions: Key Points
• The Title is Your First Clue:

• Titles often give away the purpose of the instructions. Look for keywords that tell you what you'll be able to do after following the steps.
    Example: "How to Submit a Travel Expense Report" (Clear instruction on a specific business task)
• Structure & Format:

Different types of instructions often have a specific structure. Here are some common formats to watch for:

  • Recipes: List of ingredients followed by step-by-step instructions for preparation.
  • Procedures: Clear steps outlining a specific process, often used in technical fields. (e.g., troubleshooting steps for a software program)
  • How-to Guides: Provide instructions for completing a specific task, often with visuals or diagrams.
• Language & Focus:
• The language used in the instructions can also be a clue. Recipes might use words like "mix," "bake," or "add." Business procedures might use more technical terms related to the specific task.

The world of instructions can be diverse!
But don't worry, here are some detective tricks to help you identify different types of instructions you might encounter in your business life:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does Anthony suggest Abigail look at FIRST to identify the type of instructions?
answers:
The title of the document 

The length of the document 

Any pictures or visuals included in the document

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: According to Anthony, how might safety instructions be formatted?
answers:
They often use numbered lists to outline the steps to take. 

They might have a list of ingredients and cooking times. 

They might include visuals of delicious food.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: Abigail concludes that by looking at the title, format, and language, she can figure out what kind of instructions she's dealing with. What does Anthony say about this?
answers:
"You're absolutely right! You're a natural detective!"

"That might be a little tricky. Titles can be misleading sometimes."

"Not necessarily. Some instructions are very complex and hard to understand."

params.text: Identify Different Types of Instructions: Listening and Quiz
Please listen to the conversation between Abigail and Anthony, and answer the questions below:
Anthony:
Abigail:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Abigail: I'm feeling a little overwhelmed with all these different documents at work! How do I know what kind of instructions they are?

Anthony: Don't worry! There are some clues that can help. First, look at the title. Does it mention a specific task, like "How to Submit an Invoice"? That's a good sign it's instructions.

Abigail: Okay, that makes sense. What about the way they're written?

Anthony: Absolutely! Recipes might have ingredients and cooking steps. Procedures, like safety instructions, often have numbered lists. And how-to guides might even include pictures to show you what to do.

Abigail: Wow, that's really helpful! So, by looking at the title, format, and language, I can figure out what kind of instructions I'm dealing with?

Anthony: Exactly! You're a natural!
Dialogue Text:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: The document is titled "How to Order Supplies Online" and includes a list of steps with screenshots showing each step on the computer screen. What type of instruction is this MOST likely to be?
answers:
A how-to guide with step-by-step instructions for completing a specific task. 

A recipe with a list of ingredients and cooking instructions. 

A technical procedure for troubleshooting a software issue.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: The document is titled "Monthly Sales Report Template" and includes a table with rows for things like "Product Name," "Quantity Sold," and "Total Revenue." This document likely isn't a set of instructions. What might it be instead?
answers:
A template to help organize information for a specific report.

A procedure outlining steps to follow for completing a sales task. 

A how-to guide with visuals to help you understand sales data.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: The document is titled "Emergency Fire Safety Procedures" and includes a numbered list of steps to take in case of a fire alarm. What type of instruction format is this document likely to be?
answers:
A clear set of steps outlining a specific process, often used in technical fields.

A recipe with ingredients and cooking instructions.

A how-to guide with visuals for completing a non-urgent task.

params.text: What Would You Do? Quiz
Please answer the questions below:
Review the Reading Strategy: Key Points
• Identify Key Information:

Focus on the who, what, when, where, why, and how of the instructions. Ask yourself questions like:

  • Who am I doing this for? (e.g., your manager)
  • What am I supposed to do? (e.g., submit a report)
  • When is it due? (e.g., by Friday)
  • Where do I find the information I need? (e.g., online form)
  • Why am I following these instructions? (e.g., to ensure accurate reports)
  • How do I complete the steps? (e.g., follow the listed actions)
• Pay Attention to Details:

• Instructions often rely on specific details to ensure success. Look for keywords like "first," "then," "next," or numbers indicating the order of steps. Nouns tell you what you need (e.g., "computer"), and verbs tell you what to do (e.g., "click").
• Use Context Clues:
• Don't get stuck on unfamiliar words! Look for surrounding words or phrases that might offer hints about their meaning. Sometimes, pictures or diagrams can also provide clues.
We've learned a lot about instructions! Now, let's revisit some key strategies to help you become a master reader of instructions:
• Preview & Skim:

• Before diving in, take a quick look at the title, headings, and any visuals. This gives you a general idea of what the instructions are about and helps you focus on important details when you read more closely.
    Example: Scan a recipe for the title ("Cheesy Pasta Bake") and ingredient list to get a sense of the dish before reading the detailed steps.
Review the Reading Strategy: Interactive Video

answers.text: Quickly reading the text to understand the main idea
Reading every word, searching any words you don't know in a dictionary

params.text: Please watch the following video and answer the questions:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: You see a document titled "Weekly Sales Report Form." It has a blank table with rows and columns. What would be a good first step to understand what information you need to fill in? What would be MOST helpful to get a general idea of the information required?
answers:
Quickly scan the table headings and any notes or instructions at the top of the form.

Start filling in the table with any sales data you know. 

Read the entire document carefully from beginning to end.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: You're following instructions for using a new printer, but you get stuck on a step that says "Insert the toner cartridge." You're not sure what "toner cartridge" means. What might help you understand the meaning of "toner cartridge"?
answers:
Look at the surrounding text or any pictures near the instruction for clues.

Skip this step and try inserting a regular ink cartridge instead. 

Ask a colleague a question even though they seem very busy.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: The instructions for submitting a travel expense report mention a deadline of "Friday, 5 pm." What information can you get from this detail? The deadline tells you something important about the instructions. What is it?
answers:
The report must be submitted by Friday, 5 pm to meet the deadline. 

It tells you the instructions are about booking a business trip. 

It's a suggestion for when you should start working on the report.

params.text: What Would You Do? Quiz
Please answer the questions below:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does "working remotely" mean?
answers:
Working from a location outside of the office, like your home.

Working very hard and putting in extra hours. 

Working with a group of remote controls to operate office equipment.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: The passage mentions some benefits of working remotely. What is one benefit mentioned?
answers:
A quieter work environment to avoid distractions.

The opportunity to travel to different places while working. 

The chance to work with colleagues from all over the world.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: The passage offers some tips for successful remote work. What does the tip about a "dedicated workspace" suggest?
answers:
Create a specific area in your home that is only for work to minimize distractions.

You should spend all your free time working in this space. 

You can work from any room in your house, as long as you have internet access.

params.text: Remote Work: Reading and Questions 1
Please read the following text and answer the questions:

Many companies are now offering the option to work remotely. This means employees can work from a location outside of the office, such as their home.  Here are some tips for working remotely:

•    Set Up a Dedicated Workspace: Create a comfortable and quiet space in your home that is only for work. This will help you stay focused and avoid distractions.


•    Maintain a Regular Schedule: Even though you're not in an office, try to stick to a regular work schedule. This will help you stay productive and avoid burnout.


•    Communicate Regularly: Working remotely can make it harder to stay connected with colleagues. Make sure to communicate regularly with your manager and team members via email, phone calls, or video conferencing.

By following these tips, you can successfully transition to a remote work environment.

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does "outsourcing" mean according to the passage?
answers:
Giving a specific job or service to another company to complete. 

Hiring more employees to complete additional tasks within the company. 

Creating new products or services for other companies to sell.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: The passage mentions some reasons a company might choose to outsource. What is one advantage of outsourcing mentioned in the passage?
answers:
The company can focus on its core business activities while the outsourced company handles specific tasks. 

It allows employees to take longer breaks throughout the day. 

It forces the company to create new products or services more quickly.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: The passage also mentions some disadvantages of outsourcing. What is one potential disadvantage of outsourcing mentioned?
answers:
The company might lose some control over the quality of the work being done.

Outsourcing can lead to more teamwork and collaboration within the company.

The company might have to pay more money to the outsourcing company.

params.text: Remote Work: Reading and Questions 2
Please read the following text and answer the questions:

Companies don't always do everything themselves!

Sometimes, they might outsource tasks to other companies. Outsourcing means hiring another company to complete a specific job or service. There are many reasons a company might outsource. For example, the other company might be an expert in a particular area, or it might be cheaper to outsource than to hire more employees.
International Teams: Reading and Questions
Please read the following text and answer the questions:

The world of business is becoming increasingly global! This means companies often have employees working together from all over the world. Working in international teams can be a rewarding experience, but it also has its challenges.

One benefit of international teams is the diversity of perspectives and ideas. People from different cultures can bring unique approaches to problem-solving. However, cultural differences can also lead to misunderstandings. For example, communication styles can vary, and what might seem polite in one culture might be seen as rude in another.

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What is one benefit of working in an international team according to the passage?
answers:
The team can benefit from a diversity of perspectives and ideas. 

Everyone on the team will speak the same language fluently. 

There will be fewer meetings and less communication needed.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: The passage mentions some challenges of working in international teams. What is one challenge mentioned?
answers:
Cultural differences can lead to misunderstandings in communication. 

Everyone on the team will likely have the same educational background. 

International teams typically have smaller budgets for projects.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: The passage offers some tips for success in an international team. What does the tip about "embracing technology" suggest?
answers:
Technology like video conferencing can help overcome communication barriers. 

You should avoid using technology altogether to focus on face-to-face communication. 

It's more important to focus on social activities outside of work to build relationships.

params.text:
Here are some tips for success in an international team:


•    Be Patient and Respectful: Take the time to understand your colleagues' cultural backgrounds. Be patient with communication and avoid making assumptions.


•    Embrace Technology: Video conferencing and project management tools can help bridge communication gaps and keep everyone on the same page.


•    Celebrate Diversity: View cultural differences as strengths, not weaknesses. A well-functioning international team can achieve great things!

By following these tips, you can contribute to a successful and collaborative international team environment.

Module Summary Quiz
Test your instruction-following skills! Choose the BEST answer for each question to show what you learned in this module.

choices.question: Question 1 of 6: You're looking for instructions on how to use a new meeting room booking system. What type of instruction format might you find?
answers:
A clear set of steps outlining a specific process, often used in technical fields.

A recipe with a list of ingredients and cooking steps. 

A how-to guide with visuals for completing a non-urgent task.

choices.question: Question 2 of 6: When identifying different instruction types, what is the MOST important thing to consider?
answers:
The title, format, and language used in the instructions.

The length of the document. 

The font size and style used in the document.

choices.question: Question 3 of 6: Abigail is reading a document titled "How to Submit a Travel Expense Report." What is the MOST LIKELY type of instruction this is?
answers:
A template to help organize information for a specific report.

A procedure outlining steps to follow for completing a safety task. 

A list of ingredients and cooking instructions for a delicious meal.

choices.question: Question 4 of 6: You're following instructions for making a presentation, and they mention "previewing your slides before presenting." What strategy from the reading review section can help you understand this step?
answers:
Pay attention to details like keywords that might indicate order or action.

Identify key information by asking yourself "who, what, when, where, why, and how."

Use context clues to figure out unfamiliar words by looking at surrounding text.

choices.question: Question 5 of 6: The passage about working remotely mentions creating a "dedicated workspace." What is the purpose of this tip?
answers:
To minimize distractions and help you stay focused on your work tasks. 

To encourage you to work longer hours and avoid taking breaks. 

To allow you to work from any comfortable location in your home.

choices.question: Question 6 of 6: The passage about outsourcing discusses companies hiring other companies to complete specific tasks. What is the term for this practice?
answers:
Outsourcing 

Downsizing 

Multitasking
